doc:
Roy Royston https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roy_Royston 0 Roy Royston (5 April 1899 – 7 October 1976), whose original name was Roy Charles Crowden, was an English actor who appeared in a large number of films between 1912 and 1966, beginning as a child actor. Most of his films were silents made before the First World War, during the last year of which he served as a pilot in the Royal Flying Corps and was awarded the Military Cross. He later developed a career in musical theatre, and his swan song was an appearance as an elderly clergyman in a Hammer Horror film of 1966. Roy_Royston ( 5_April_1899 – 7_October_1976 ) , whose_original_name was Roy_Charles_Crowden , was an_English_actor who appeared in a_large_number of films between 1912_and_1966 , beginning as a_child_actor . Most of his_films were silents made before the_First_World_War , during the_last_year of which he served as a_pilot in the_Royal_Flying_Corps and was_awarded the_Military_Cross . He later developed a_career in musical_theatre , and his_swan_song was an_appearance as an_elderly_clergyman in a_Hammer_Horror_film of 1966 .
